page.title: 14Well Vale House
page.content: The building of the present house at Well Vale started in 1721 and was completed in 1733.The owner at this time was James Bateman, who became a governor of Alford Grammar School in 1725. The estate dates back to the Norman Conquest and was also mentioned in the last Domesday Book. The estate contains 17O acres. In 1725 two urns were found in Well, containing several Roman coins. These are being preserved and one day will be on show in a museum. From the classical revival church which stands north_west from where the present house is built there is a pleasant view of the house. The house is at present unoccupied, being last lived in 3 years ago until the death of the last owner. It was used as a film location for BBC's {Pride and Prejudice}shown this year.
